meanings.definition: The official inspection and measurement of woolen cloth.
meanings.sent1: During the alnage, they checked the quality of the woolen cloth.
meanings.sent2: The alnage determined the exact measurements of the fabric.
meanings.sent3: The alnage officer found a tiny mouse hiding in the fabric rolls!
meanings.sent4: The alnage was like a detective, uncovering any flaws in the cloth.
meanings.sent5: The alnage process was as meticulous as a painter creating a masterpiece.

meanings.definition: A tax or duty on woolen cloth.
meanings.sent1: The alnage was a fee imposed on woolen cloth merchants.
meanings.sent2: Merchants had to pay the alnage before selling their fabric.
meanings.sent3: The alnage tax felt like a sneaky thief stealing from the sellers.
meanings.sent4: The alnage duty weighed on the merchants like a heavy burden.
meanings.sent5: The alnage charge was as unavoidable as the changing seasons.

meanings.definition: To inspect and measure woolen cloth for quality and quantity.
meanings.sent1: She would alnage the cloth to ensure it met the standards.
meanings.sent2: The workers alnaged the fabric before shipping it out.
meanings.sent3: He alnaged the cloth with such focus, it was almost comical.
meanings.sent4: Alnaging the fabric was like solving a puzzle for him.
meanings.sent5: The way she alnaged the cloth made it seem like an art form.
